name: I'm Julia B.Grenier,
title: a Software Engineering Co-op Student
checkout: Checkout these links to see what I have done

skills.cpp: After making small projects and games using C++, I applied my knowledge during my software engineering internships!
skills.python: I used Python during my internship at Autodesk and I also developped a machine-learning model during the CodeML hackathon using Python.
skills.csharp: Using Unity, I developed a 2D game called 'All Rat Remains' in a team of 5 during the McGameJam Hackathon.
skills.java: I developed a desktop application in Java using JavaFX and a web application using Spring Boot.
skills.web: In addition to this website, I have build multiple web applications during hackathons and school projects
skills.editors: I use VS code most of the time but I like to use Vim when I am inside a terminal.
skills.databases: I have hands-on experience from projects using PostgreSQL for relational databases and Firebase NoSQL for real-time data storage.
skills.version_control: I have experience using different version control systems such as Git and Perforce.
skills.other: During my internships, I gained hands-on experience with various tools like Docker, Jenkins, and Jira, as well as exposure to Agile methodologies.

matrox.title: Matrox, C++
matrox.subtitle: Software Developer Intern
info: Currently contributing to the maintenance and enhancement of the build system and the internal development tools.

autodesk.title: Autodesk, C++
autodesk.subtitle: Software Developer Intern
info: Redesigned the project management window of Autodesk Flame by simplifying navigation and introducing four new features, which made tasks like deleting projects quicker and more intuitive, leading to an estimated 50% reduction in project management time.
Optimized automated testing suites by updating over 10 Python test cases, ensuring compatibility with the new design.
Ensured code quality by participating in code reviews using Git and GitHub.

mirametrix.title: Mirametrix Inc., C++
mirametrix.subtitle: Software Engineer Intern
info: Resolved over 15 bugs in the Qt application, directly improving 20% of the application's features.
Utilized Perforce as the primary version control system, effectively managing code and tracking changes.
Participated in daily stand-up meetings following the Scrum methodology to foster open communication and provide updates on the progress of tasks tracked on Jira.
Engaged in more than 10 code reviews, providing suggestions to team members and improving code quality.

GuessOrMess.title: Web Game
GuessOrMess.subtitle: Guess Or Mess
info: Developed Guess or MESS, an interactive study platform that transforms Anki flashcards into live, multiplayer quiz games, enhancing engagement through competitive leaderboards and real-time gameplay.
Utilized TypeScript, React.js, and Tailwind CSS to build a responsive and intuitive user interface for seamless gameplay and deck management.
Leveraged Firebase for backend operations, including flashcard processing, game state management, and web app hosting, ensuring scalability and real-time functionality.

FitHub.title: Full Stack Web Application, Java
FitHub.subtitle: FitHub
info: Designed and developed a BOLD(full-stack) web application for managing a local sports center, providing a platform for owners and instructors to schedule classes and enabling customers to register for sessions.
Utilized Spring Boot and PostgreSQL for the back end and HTML, CSS, and Vue.js for the front end.
Implemented RESTful APIs with Spring Boot to handle CRUD operations, user authentication, and data validation.

AssetPlus.title: Desktop Application, Java
AssetPlus.subtitle: AssetPlus
info: Developed a desktop application using JavaFX in a team of 6 that keeps track of defective assets in a hotel.
Optimized development using Umple and by applying the MVC(Model-View-Controller) software design pattern, leading to a modular architecture.
Implemented tests applying the concepts of behavior-driven development using JUnit, and Gherkin.
BOLD(Won) the title 'Best Application' against 15 other teams after presenting the app's efficiency and showcasing the additional features added, such as BOLD(multi-language support).

AllRatRemains.title: 2D Unity Game, C#
AllRatRemains.subtitle: All Rat Remains - McGameJam Hackathon
info: Collaborated with 4 teammates to create a 2D game in C# incorporating mazes, puzzles, and a mysterious plot.
Won the category 'Best Audio Design.'
Efficiently managed the game's implementations using Unity and Git.

CodeML.title: Machine Learning Model, Python
CodeML.subtitle: Model Predicting the Risk of a Stroke - CodeML Hackathon
info: Worked in a team of 4 with Google Colab to build an artificial intelligence model in Python that predicts if someone will have a stroke.
Reached the top 5 of our ranking with the developed model.
Trained the model using classifiers from the Scikit-learn library on Google Colab to analyze 2000 data points.
Learned in a machine-learning workshop how to train a model to recognize clothing.

TicTacToe.title: C++ Game
TicTacToe.subtitle: TicTacToe
info: Programmed a Tic-Tac-Toe game in C++ with the SFML software development library.
